data.title: Autostrade per l'Italia
data.meta_description: Del gruppo Autostrade per l'Italia fanno parte altre 5 Società concessionarie autostradali e 7 Società che operano nei servizi accessori al core business autostradale e rivestono un ruolo fondamentale nell'attuazione del piano di trasformazione della Società.
data.text:
Elisabetta Oliveri

She graduated from classical high school in 1982 with a final mark of 60/60 and in 1987 she obtained a Degree in Electronic Engineering at the University of Genoa with a final mark of 110/110 cum laude and recommendations for publication.

After obtaining a scholarship in Operating Systems from DEC - Digital Equipment Co., followed by an experience as a RW specialist, she started her working carrier at Marconi Plc, an Italian and international leading group in electronic communication systems for defence and Telco, where she worked from 1991 to 2001. After a career in the technical field, in which she developed a solid experience in high-tech R&D software, she was appointed manager of the “IP, Voice and Data Networks Test Division” for the Group and after that, she was appointed Senior Vice President Strategy of Marconi Mobile S.p.A.

In 2001, she joined Sirti, a leading engineering group of telecommunications networks, wired networks, installations for railway lines and local public transport and systems integration. From 2001 to 2003, she held the position of Director of ‘Strategic Planning and Business Development’, taking care of defining the company’s strategy and planning the evolutionary process in order to diversify the Group both in terms of supply and market. In 2003, she was appointed General Manager of the Group, with wider responsibilities in commercial, technical and operational fields, but also Managing Director of Sirti Progetto Reti S.p.A., Board of Directors of Sirti Sistemi S.p.A., and she continued to climb the ladder until she reached the position of CEO.

In 2011, she joined Gruppo Fabbri Vignola SpA, firstly as General Manager, and in 2012 she was appointed Chief Executive Officer of the Group. The company, world leader in the fresh food packaging sector, with factories in Italy and Switzerland and worldwide sales both through subsidiaries and through a wide network of partners, was awarded by the SME Observatory / Global Strategy as “Excellent Company” by their profitability results achieved in the five-year period 2012-2016.

Since 2019, she has been Chairwoman of Sagat S.p.A., the management company of Turin’s “Sandro Pertini” Airport, of which she was Board of Directors in the three-year period 2016-2019.

Since May 2022, she has been Chairwoman of Autostrade per l’Italia S.p.A.

Since 2010, she has held the position of Board of Directors in important Italian and international companies.

She currently holds the following positions:

ERG S.p.A: Board of Directors, member of the Control, Risk and Sustainability Committee

TREVI FINANZIARIA INDUSTRIALE: Chairwoman of the Appointments and Remuneration Committee and member of the Committee for Transactions with Related Parties

STELLA S.p.A.: Board of Directors

INDUSTRIE DE NORA S.p.A: Board of Directors, Chairwoman of the Appointments and Remuneration Committee, Member of the Committee for Transactions with Related Parties

CIR S.p.A.: member of the Control, Risk and Sustainability Committee

In the past:

From 2011 to 2014: Board of Directors of ATM – Azienda Trasporti Milanesi S.p.A. From 2011 t 2013: Chairwoman of the Supervisory Body

From 2010 to 2019: Board of Directors of SNAM SpA, in which she held the positions of Chairwoman of the Control and Risk Committee and Chairwoman of the Remuneration Committee, at different times.

From 2012 to 2019: Board of Directors of GEDI SpA, Lead Independent Director, Chairwoman of the Control and Risk Committee and member of the Committee for Transactions with Related Parties.

From 2012 to 2016: Board of Directors of EUTELSAT S.A. and member of the Audit Committee.

From 2014 to 2019: Board of Directors of Gruppo BANCA FARMAFACTORING SpA, Chairwoman of the Remuneration Committee and Chairwoman of the Committee for Transactions with Related Parties.

From 2019 to 2021: Board of Directors of FINCANTIERI SpA, Chairwoman of the Sustainability Committee, and member of the Remuneration Committee

In addition to her professional career, since 2009 she has been involved in social and solidarity engagement through her activity in the Furio Solinas Onlus Foundation, of which she is founder and Chairwoman. The Foundation is a non-profit organisation carrying out charitable and support activities for those in need, with particular attention to minors and to the community.

She was appointed Cavaliere al Merito of the Italian Republic.

In 2016, she was awarded by Federmanager – Aldai with the prize “Merito e Talento”

Roberto Tomasi

He graduated with honours in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Padua. He has been Chief Executive Officer of Autostrade per l'Italia since February 2019. During his career, he has held important managerial positions both in the operations industry and as managing director in the design and construction of major investments and in the management of complex multinational companies. Upon starting his professional career, he improved his education with important experiences, including: an Executive Program at the Harvard Business School, in the USA; an International Executive Program at INSEAD, France; and a Master's degree in Finance and Project Control at SDA Bocconi in Milan.

He gained his first professional experiences in the Engineer Corps of the Italian Army, in the military vehicles division at IVECO, and then at FIAT AVIO, in the Heavy-Duty division, where he worked in an international context. In 1996, after a short period in the service of Nuovo Pignone - GE Group - he joined the ENEL Group, covering various managerial roles and gaining an experience of approximately 20 years, during which he held multiple roles of increasing responsibility.

1998-2001 - VP BU La Spezia-Genova power plants

2001-2004 - SVP CCGT Power plants 7 GW Enel Group

2004-2006 - SVP Procurement Major Project Enel Group

2007-2014 - EVP Engineering and Construction Thermal Power & Nuclear conventional island Plans Enel Group

2014-2015 – EVP International Coal Power Plants Enel Group

He joined Autostrade per l'Italia in July 2015 and held the position of General Director for New Works until 2018. Since February 2019, he has been the new Chief Executive Officer of Autostrade per l'Italia, leading the process of corporate renewal and transformation.

The new corporate transformation plan is characterised by a profound "change management" programme, which entails hiring over 2900 new resources and changing the entire managerial team at the different levels of the Group.

Mr. Tomasi's management strategy aims at transforming ASPI from a pure concession holder to an integrated operator bringing about a powerful industrial transformation through multiple players:

MOVYON

is the leader in the development and integration of Intelligent Transport Systems solutions and a centre of excellence for research and innovation of the Autostrade per l'Italia Group.

TECNE

manages key engineering projects for the evolution of the network and coordinates asset design activities, works management and monitoring of the maintenance and investment plan.

FREETOX

deals with the development and provision of innovative services related to sustainable mobility and environmental sustainability.

AMPLIA

deals with the construction, maintenance, restoration and modernisation of infrastructures and the development of materials and technologies for road paving.

ELGEA

operates in the generation of clean energy by enhancing the surfaces around the motorway network and focusing on technologies and systems capable of producing renewable energy.

A great deal of effort has been put on creating a new concept of the approach to business, now based on the digitalisation of processes and assets. Finally, Mr. Tomasi is shaping a new vision of a future-oriented Company which aims to become a real operator of integrated mobility by building an industrial plan which, in addition to investments and maintenance in a medium-long term perspective, will invest in new skills to cope with the sustainable transformation of mobility, restoring Autostrade’s reputation of a national and international leading player: this will be based on a new ethics of behaviours, on transparent actions and on the ability to respect corporate commitments.

Massimiliano Arces

In 1997, he graduated with honours in Civil and Hydraulic Engineering. After initial experience in geotechnical design firms, in 1999 he joined Arthur Andersen and then Deloitte & Touche, where he worked as a business consultant – in the field of HSE and social responsibility - supporting major Italian industrial companies.

From 2005 to 2008 he worked as a manager at Det Norske Veritas - a ship classification company and world leader in risk management and safety improvement solutions - where he strengthened his environmental and safety management skills in important national and international contexts.

In May 2008 he joined the Astaldi Group, where he gained significant international experience in the HSE management of complex infrastructure projects and where, until 2020, he held positions of increasing responsibility in the parent company, including HSE Manager, Sustainability Manager and head of Organisation and Integrated Management Systems.

He is a lecturer in dozens of masters and specialisation courses, including several EMAS and Ecolabel schools and, most recently, the Executive Programme in Compliance Management at Luiss Business School in Rome.

Since 2020 he has been a manager at Autostrade per l'Italia, part of the Group's transformation process focused on cultural and organisational growth in the area of Health, Safety and Environment.

He has been Group HSE Director since September 2023.

Gianluigi Iacobone

Gianluigi Iacobone was born in Canosa di Puglia in 1979 and he graduated in Economics and Commerce. He joined Autostrade per l'Italia in January 2005 and is currently the Director of Studies and Strategies and Head of the CEO Office. He is also a member of the Board of Directors of Movyon. He was Deputy Director of Purchasing and Procurement between 2021 and 2022.

From 2020 to 2021, he was a member of the Board of Directors of one of the service subsidiaries of the Group (Giove Clear). He has more than 15 years' experience in planning and control, with various roles and responsibilities both in the control of the company's business and human resources and in the management of other group companies, contributing to the redesign of processes, the definition and continuous improvement of reporting and the development of models and KPIs for measuring performance. After his graduation in 2003, he became a contract researcher in economics and innovation management at the Department of Economics of the Gabriele D'Annunzio University of Pescara, where he worked on national, sectoral and territorial innovation systems until January 2005.

Piergiorgio Peluso

He graduated in Economic and Social Sciences from Bocconi University, he joined Mediobanca in 1994 in the Holdings Department.

In 1998, he joined Credit Suisse First Boston (CSFB), where he managed complex transactions in the credit and utilities sectors.

In 2002, he joined the Capitalia Group, where he was responsible for the Corporate Division of the banking group. Following the acquisition of Capitalia by Unicredit, he took on the role of Head of Corporate and Investment Banking (CIB) for Italy and Chief Executive Officer of the Group’s Corporate Bank.

In mid-2011, he joined Fondiaria SAI as General Manager.

In 2012, he left the insurance field to join the telecommunications sector, in particular Telecom Italia Group (TIM), where he held the position of Chief Financial Officer of the Group.

He has been Chief Financial Officer of Autostrade per l'Italia since 2nd March 2023.
